It's another Workout Wednesday Bobcats. Coach says it must be your favorite day of the week!
Before we start exercising, we are going to briefly discuss why we need exercise.

One of the biggest reasons we want to stay active is to strengthen the most important muscle in our bodies. What muscle do you think that is? That’s right, it's your heart. Your heart is a muscle that never gets to rest. And you only get one heart, so you want to make sure it keeps doing its job of pumping blood through your body as long as possible.
Just like any other muscle, your heart gets stronger when you make it work harder. So, during today's exercises, we are going to feel our hearts work harder. We are going to exercise for 30 seconds, then we will count how many times our heart beats over the following 10 seconds. We have 10 exercises, and we will go through all 10 of them twice. Keep track of how many times your heart beats after each exercise … kind of like keeping score. Then let Coach M know which exercises made your heart beat fastest. Sound good?
Enough talk. Let's get SWEATY!
